name: Nori Furikake Deviled Eggs
author: taylorpatti
summary: An Asian spin on a picnic classic that will make you rethink hard-boiled eggs as a gourmet delicacy.
ingredients: ⅓ cup mayonnaise, or more to taste
directions: Place eggs in a saucepan and cover with water
Bring to a boil, remove from heat, and let eggs stand in hot water for 15 minutes
Remove eggs from hot water, cool in a bowl of ice water, about 5 minutes, and peel
Cut boiled eggs in half using a sharp knife
Remove yolks and place in a large mixing bowl
Add mayonnaise, garlic, coconut aminos, 1 teaspoon nori furikake, salt, and pepper
Mix together until no lumps remain
Use a spoon to fill each egg half with yolk mixture
Garnish with a sprinkling of nori furikake
Serve right away or refrigerate 1 to 2 days
